result.execSummary:
The defendant Randy L Bolstad was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendent in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

  Pay DOC Supervision fees.

  Undergo any other assessments or evaluations deemed appropriate by PO and follow through with any treatment recommendations.

Credit for 9 days if probation revoked.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Randy L Bolstad

records.addlTxt: terminated

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Thomas Huh

From: Def Re: wish to reject probation & req court appt atty
Branch 5: should complete application w/SPD office for atty, copies of ltr sent to PO & SPD office regarding rejecting probation

Request for Modification or Change in Sentence filed
GLD: denied
fom PO Fields   re: Judicial Review

State by N/A;  Def in custody w/o Atty /  PO Colton Fields
JUDICIAL REVIEW
CRT:  Mr Bolstad you rec'd letter from DOC...PO Fields wants to address your non-compliance - in his mind you don't have any intent on following thru w/ probation - Mr. Fields is asking for re-evaluation
ADA Suleski now present
Def:  I was serving a sentence on JSS - I believe violations were already addressed
CRT:  if you don't intend to start Probation, would you like to be resentenced to not consider probtion?
Def:  Can you do that today?
PO Fields:  Most everything is in letter - you have addressed it
CRT:  if I were to speculate, it was not really intent to re-sentence him today - were you serious about that?
PO:  Dept has not been abel to make any progress
CRT:  do you want to be re-sentenced as if you are rejecting probation?
Def;  yes - also, my Uncle passed away - I was very close to, I am trying to work out so I can attend the services that are in couple days - willing to cooperate in any way...
CRT: Mr. Bolstad, you cannot follow even simple rules...not even sure you would return to jail
Def comments..CRT is wrong
CRT:  I have no intention of releasing you from jail
Def;  I do want to reject probation - does not want to talk to atty
CRT:  we would need different date & if you want to consult w/ atty, one of these charges is a Felony
Def:  no I don't - can I have it ASAP
Suleski:  we would ask for PSI & set for Sentencing 60 days out
Def:  didn't think PSI necessary - req it take place sooner
CRT:  I also find 60 days not approp but CRT has no control over DOC -
Def:  what is objective of this Hrg?
CRT:  objective was for you to say you would comply w/ probation but it didn't work out that way
Def:  I brought up issue of funeral...
CRT comments..
Def continues to argue & says this is double jeopardy...wants to be successful & comply in all aspects in life
CRT: you indicated you were not interested in staying on probation so we are now looking at sentencing date
Def:  I was speaking in terms of specifically getting out for Uncle's funeral, no I do not want to reject probation
CRT:  OK, then we are talking about your consequences for your failure to comply.  Given what has occurred, what is PO's position?
Fields:  My Hold will be in place until Mon, after that I do not have a plan...
ADA HYNEK now present
CRT goes over violations...
CRT:  AS AN ADDITIONAL CONDITION OF PROBATION, DEF TO SERVE 30 DAYS COUNTY JAIL TO BEGIN ON 6-13-16 AS SOON AS THE PO HOLD IS LIFTED - NO CREDIT.  NO JUSTICE SANCTIONS.  AS SOON AS RELEASED, DEF TO IMMEDIATELY REPORT TO PO

I will let Jail know def can sign the bond & be released.
